Detailed Description

Network group of process Such object allows to define a dynamic group of nodes with synchronisation to wait the end of the group definition. A group has a name (string). A node has a master node that collect information about the group (who is in the group). A group is initialized on all nodes with the name of the group and the master node as parameter. A node that want to join a group, only call 'join' method. Each time a node joins the group, a message is sent to the master node to add the node in the group, then this message is forwarded to all other known process. Note that all methods (join/leave/broadcast) that imply a communication to other nodes (at least the master node) wait for the completion of the asynchronous active message send. They throw an exception in case of a failure of communication.

Member Function Documentation

void Net::Group::broadcast ( int  e,
ka_uint64_t  value = 0,
const char *  arg = 0 
) throw (InvalidArgumentError,ComFailure)

Broadcast an event to all locally known nodes of the group Each nodes locally referenced in the group receives the event through the notify_event method. Note that this method does not implies that all nodes in the group will receive the event. For instance is a node is under join the group, it may be known by some nodes of the group but not by the caller of this method.

Parameters:
e is the event to broadcast only value less or equal to 32 bits integer are communicated
value an extra parameter to broadcast (64 bits integer).
Exceptions:
InvalidArgumentError if the group is not initialized
ComFailure if the communication has error during sending message

Return the NodeInfo of the i-th item in the group No thread safe with addition/deletion of nodes. Mutex on the group object should be locked.

void Net::Group::join (  )  throw (InvalidArgumentError,ComFailure)

Join the group All nodes that join the group receive the E_JOIN event. The event is notified after the addition of the node in the group and before communication.

Exceptions:
InvalidArgumentError if the group is not initialized
ComFailure if the communication has error during sending message
void Net::Group::leave (  )  throw (InvalidArgumentError,ComFailure)

Leave the group All nodes in the group receive the E_LEAVE event. The event is notified after the addition of the node in the group and before communication.

Exceptions:
InvalidArgumentError if the group is not initialized
ComFailure if the communication has error during sending message

Reimplemented in WS::Community.

void Net::Group::lock (  ) 

Lock the group, prevent processes from joining All the join events will be treated after unlock()

void Net::Group::notify ( GlobalId  gid,
int  e,
ka_uint64_t  value,
const char *  arg 
)

Inherited from Util::InterfaceNotify Method called when a new node join the group The event defines what is signaled. This method could be redefined in derived class in order to change the behaviour when local group receive event. For E_JOIN and E_LEAVE events, the value is the gid of the process that join or leave the group.

Parameters:
gid the global id of the process that emits the event
e the event, see code above and in utils_signal.h
value the value given in broadcast

Reimplemented in WS::Community.

void Net::Group::setup ( Network *  net,
const std::string &  name,
GlobalId  gid_master,
bool  local 
) throw (Util::InvalidArgumentError) [protected]

Initialize a new Group object. This method should be called with locking grpmgr_object to ensure atomicity in modification of known_group. The object id is setup to Util::hash_value_str value computed from the name

void Net::Group::setup ( Network *  net,
const std::string &  name,
GlobalId  gid_master 
) throw (Util::InvalidArgumentError)

Setup fields Each node which will compose the group should call this method before any use of other method.

Parameters:
net the network object used to send message.
name the name of the group
gid_master the gid of the master node that manages the group
size_t Net::Group::size (  )  const

Return size of the (local view of the) group No thread safe with addition/deletion of nodes. Mutex on the group object should be locked.
